result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Florence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Subject to work release and good time. 7 days sentence credit if revoked.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.
Must report to Probation today. Probation may petition court for early release from Probation if necessary.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Must establish payment plan within 30 days.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Cannot vote. Cannot hold elective office. Loss of other civil rights until restored.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation Agent if necessary. Subject to work release. NOT subject to good time.
